channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead Tree, 28th June
item.description:
Dead tree Tree in Road - branches dead hanging. Looks like about to fall and dead branches flapping in wind right over highway. If branches were to fall would cause RTC and if tree were to fall would fall on property either way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: N20 Bottles Collected but need disposing, 28th June
item.description:
Several N20 canisters have been collated and bagged up. They cannot be disposed of in household rubbish and have been flytipped in various places along Marion Crescent. They have been placed by this communal bin but need taking please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12B, Marion Crescent, Poverest, Orpington, London

item.description:

item.title: Cambridge gardens / Oxfors Road, 28th June
item.description:
Ongoing Issues During St. Augustine School Boot Sale every Sat Each time the boot sale is held at St. Augustine School, the surrounding area is overrun by street vendors selling unwanted goods. The event has become disruptive, leaving the neighbourhood littered and degraded. While the organisers appear to profit, there is little accountability or effort to clean up afterward. Residents are increasingly frustrated. This needs to be addressed with better oversight and post-event cleanup measures.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cambridge Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Company digging the street have dug a trench and cover it with a metal plate, 28th June
item.description:
The plate that cover the trench makes a very loud metallic noise every time a vehicle crosses it and the neighborhood including the hotel residence cannot sleep at night. We have had a lot of complaints from our guests who are threatening not to pay for the night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15-17, Charlotte Street, Fitzrovia, London

item.title: Concern – Overgrown Vegetation Obstructing Public Pathway Dear [Council Name or, 28th June
item.description:
I am writing to raise a concern regarding an overgrown tree or plant that is obstructing the public footpath outside a house on Merrow Street near the Queen Elizabeth pub . The vegetation appears to be coming from a property (not certain if it is privately owned), and it has grown significantly over the footpath. As a result, pedestrians – especially those with prams, wheelchairs, or mobility aids – are being forced to step into the road to pass, which presents a serious safety risk. I would appreciate it if the council could look into this matter and take appropriate action to ensure the pathway is made safe and accessible for all members of the public.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Liverpool Grove, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
